explanation: Denotes a particular thing or things already mentioned or known.
Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences.
Conveying thoughts, feelings, or information through speech or writing.
The course or path along which something moves or lies.
Used to single out an individual member of a specified group or class.
Referring to someone or something for the first time.
An unspecified person; somebody.
A thing that is unspecified or unknown.
By this or that time; before or by now.
Spoken about or referred to in a conversation or piece of writing.
Able to recover quickly from setbacks or difficult conditions.
Holding firmly to something; persistent and determined.
Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
Conveying thoughts, feelings, or information through speech or writing.
A set of circumstances in which one finds oneself; a state of affairs.
Shut in on all sides; surrounded.
All around (someone or something).
Has objective reality or being.
Be entitled or appointed to act or speak for (someone), especially in an official capacity.
A thing that is unspecified or unknown.
Speaking or writing directly to (someone).
Of or denoting the sex that produces small, typically mobile gametes, especially spermatozoa, with which a female may be fertilized or inseminated to produce offspring.
A living organism that feeds on organic matter, typically having specialized sense organs and nervous system and able to respond rapidly to stimuli.
At a previous or earlier time; before.
Spoken about or referred to in a conversation or piece of writing.
Relating to the body as opposed to the mind.
Bear all the weight of; hold up.
A thing that is unspecified or unknown.
The way in which two or more concepts, objects, or people are connected, or the state of being connected.
All of; entire.
Fitting a person as a member.
Connected with something else.
At a previous or earlier time; before.
Spoken about or referred to in a conversation or piece of writing.
A person who opposes another in a contest, game, or argument.
Regard (someone) as likely to do or be something.
Beneath (a surface).
Having the same opinion about something; in accord.
Conditions attached to an agreement.
Material that provides official information or evidence or that serves as a record.
Happen; take place.
Happening by chance rather than intention.
The action or process of discovering or being discovered.
Noticeably happy and optimistic.
The state of being fully prepared for something.
The quality or state of being prepared to do something; readiness.
Possess, own, or hold.
The quality of doing something without delay; readiness.
Enthusiastic and active interest in something.
Giving out or reflecting a lot of light; shining.
Full of life and energy; active and outgoing.
Of very great extent or quantity; immense.
Showing a great deal of variety; very different.
An arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity.
Successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective or result) by effort, skill, or courage.
The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.
A thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.
The ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way.
A set of forms taken by a verb to indicate the time, and sometimes also the continuance or completeness, of the action in relation to the time of the utterance.
Having objective reality or being.
